content:
• Monday, February 6, 2017
  • CHTR

    Charter closes sale of $1B in 10-year notes

    • Charter Communications (CHTR -1.9%) today closed on its sale of $1B in debt.
    • The company issued the notes at par through subsidiaries CCO Holdings and CCO Holdings Capital.
    • The debt is in senior unsecured notes due 2027 and bearing interest of 5.125% annually.
    • At last report, Charter noted total long-term debt of $59.95B, and cash and equivalents of $1.17B.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • FMC

    FMC -4.3% after guiding Q1 earnings well below estimates

    • FMC Corp. (NYSE:FMC) -4.3% AH after reporting slightly weaker than expected Q4 earnings and revenues, and issuing below consensus Q1 earnings.
    • FMC says Q4 agricultural segment earnings rose 25% Y/Y to $127M, health and nutrition earnings gained 17% to $54M, and lithium earnings jumped more than 90% to $21M.
    • For FY 2017, FMC sees EPS of $3.20-$3.60, in-line with the $3.31 analyst consensus estimate, but for Q1 it expects EPS of just $0.50-$0.60, vs. $0.74 consensus, as ag segment earnings are forecast at $60M-$70M, a ~20% Y/Y decrease at the mid-point.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM | 4 Comments
  • SCOR

    ComScore confirms delisting coming Wednesday morning

    • ComScore (NASDAQ:SCOR) has confirmed it's heard from Nasdaq, which intends to delist the stock and suspend trading effective with Wednesday's market open.
    • That's after comScore informed the exchange's Hearings Panel that it wasn't going to meet a Feb. 23 deadline to regain compliance with financial reporting requirements.
    • Shares have stabilized some after hours, up 0.8%, after sliding 28.4% during market hours.
    • ComScore has appealed the decision, but can't give assurance that it will be stayed before Wednesday.
    • Earlier, Oppenheimer pulled its Buy rating and $35 price target in anticipation of a likely delisting, though it thinks the firm could still draw a buyer from suitors like Adobe, Oracle or IBM.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM
  • OXY

    Occidental Petroleum says it replaced nearly 190% of 2016 production

    • Occidental Petroleum (NYSE:OXY) +2.7% AH after reporting a nearly 190% replacement ratio, including 290% resources replacement in the Permian Basin.
    • OXY says its preliminary worldwide proved reserves at year-end 2016 rose to 2.4B boe from 2.2B boe at the end of 2015, and had proved reserve additions from all sources of 437M boe from production of 231M boe in 2016.
    • OXY says its 2016 reserves program additions for Permian resources came in at historically low finding and development costs of less than $9/boe.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • LMNX

    Luminex Q4 revenues up 20%; earnings down 117%; cash flow ops up 3%; shares down 2% after hours

    • Luminex (NASDAQ:LMNX) Q4 results ($M): Total Revenues: 72.3 (+19.7%); Assays: 36.7 (+36.4%).
    • Net Income: (3.4) (-116.7%); Non-GAAP Net Income: 4.6 (-80.9%); EPS: (0.08) (-116.7%); Non-GAAP EPS: 0.11 (-80.7%); CF Ops: 13.9 (+3.4%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenues: $295M - 305M.
    • Q1 Guidance: Revenues: $73M - 75M.
    • Shares are off 2% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • AUPH

    New chief at Aurinia; shares down 9%

    • Aurinia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUPH) appoints founder and Chairman Dr. Richard Glickman as Chairman and CEO replacing Charles Rowland who resigned. His primary goal is to advance lupus nephritis candidate voclosporin through Phase 3 development and ultimately into the marketplace.
    • Shares are off 9% after hours on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM | 12 Comments
  • GPS

    Gap sees above consensus Q4 results after strong holiday quarter

    • Gap (NYSE:GPS) +3.1% AH after reporting stronger than expected Q4 sales, which rose 1% Y/Y to $4.43B and beat the analyst consensus estimate of $4.39B, and net sales for January rose 2% to $828M.
    • Gap says sales at stores open for at least a year improved 2%, as Old Navy and Gap sales offset a 3% decline at Banana Republic.
    • Gap also says it expects Q4 adjusted EPS of $0.51-$0.50 vs. analyst expectations for $0.45; for the full year, Gap expects adjusted EPS of $2.01-$2.02 vs. its earlier view of $1.87-$1.92.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 1 Comment

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: MFIN +7.1%. ALSN +5.4%. GPS +3.1%. FN +3.3%. NM +2.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: HQY -5.3%. KN -4.3%. AM -3.4%. CEMP -3.2%. YRCW -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • FN

    Fabrinet +2.85%; Q2 2017, outlook positive

    • Q2 2017 results – revenue $351.2M (+50.7% Y/Y, $16.13M above estimates), EPS $0.91 ($0.12 above estimates), net income $34.5M (+89% Y/Y)
    • Q3 2017 projections – revenue $360M-$364M (consensus $334.79), EPS $0.87-$0.89 (consensus $0.78)
    • Other developments – CEO succession plan, with no set timeframe, initiated.
    • Fabrinet (NYSE:FN) CEO Tom Mitchell: "We exceeded our guidance for the second quarter, with revenue that grew 51% from a year ago. We are enthusiastic about our continued business momentum, driven by on-going strength in the optical market and new customer programs. We’re also excited to see the beginning of the transfer of programs from our new product introduction facility in Santa Clara to Thailand, and believe our growing NPI pipeline will support our growth in the years ahead."
    • After hours – Fabrinet $43.30
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • Presentation
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • CLLS

    Cellectis gets green light to start clinical trials in U.S. with UCART123; shares ahead 9% after hours

    • Thinly traded Cellectis (NASDAQ:CLLS) is up 9% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has approved its IND for off-the-shelf CAR T candidate UCART123. The company plans to initiate Phase 1 studies in H1.
    • UCART123 is an engineered T-cell therapy candidate that targets CD123, an antigen found certain leukemic cells in acute myeloid leukemia (AML) as well as leukemic and other cancer cells in blastic plasmacytoid dendritic cell neoplasm (BPDCN).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • AM

    Antero Midstream to launch 5M-share offering, forms JV with MPLX

    • Antero Midstream Partners (NYSE:AM) -3.3% AH after commencing a public offering of 5M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 750K units.
    • AM says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, including repayment of part of the outstanding borrowings under its revolving credit facility.
    • AM also says it is forming a 50-50 joint venture with MPLX subsidiary MarkWest Energy to develop processing and fractionation assets in the Marcellus Shale in West Virginia, in which it expects to invest up to $800M through 2020.
    • AM says the expansion opportunity allows it to target peer-leading compound annual distribution growth of 28%-30% through 2020, while maintaining a strong balance sheet and increasing its distributable cash flow coverage to more than 1.25x during the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • ARCT

    Alcobra says FDA pre-IND ADAIR meeting "productive," shares ahead 6% after hours

    • Nano cap Alcobra (ADHD) perks up 6% after hours on increased volume on the heels of its announcement of a productive pre-IND meeting with the FDA regarding ADAIR (Abuse-Deterrent Amphetamine Immediate-Release), its candidate to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
    • The company says the agency provided guidance on the necessary steps for an NDA submission, expected to happen next year.
    • The company will host a conference call tomorrow, February 7, at 8:30 am ET to discuss its plans.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • FOX

    Fox shares turn down 2.5% after mixed second quarter results

    • Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX, FOXA) A shares have turned down after hours, -2.5%, as the company logged a beat on profits with strong results in cable and sports, though revenues missed slightly.
    • Income from continuing operations grew by more than 27%, to $857M. Revenues grew 4% on strength from cable and TV, with a drag from the film studio.
    • Total segment OIBDA was up 15% to $1.99B, above consensus for $1.86B.
    • "Our record-breaking post-season baseball run underscores the immense value of our sports programming, as well as the broader competitive advantage we have built through our other leadership positions in entertainment and news," says a statement from Rupert and Lachlan Murdoch.
    • Revenue by segment: Cable Network Programming, $3.97B (up 7.1%); Television, $1.92B (up 11.8%); Filmed Entertainment, $2.27B (down 3.9%); Other, -$472M.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • WPP

    ComScore now down 28.9%; Oppenheimer pulls Buy rating

    • ComScore (SCOR -28.9%) -- on the skids today after saying it would miss yet another compliance deadline tied to an ongoing restatement of its financials -- has had its Buy rating pulled by Oppenheimer.
    • The news means likely delisting of comScore from Nasdaq, which will call for selling by index funds and mutual funds.
    • And while Oppenheimer says checks indicate "business as usual," it expects that shareholder WPP (WPPGY) will push for a company sale late this year. It's gone from Outperform to "Not Rated" and pulled its $35 price target (shares have tumbled from $30.74 to $23.06 today and still falling into the close).
    • Who could buy comScore? The firm thinks Adobe, Oracle and IBM are likely suitors, but "we believe there is no rush ahead of completion of the re-audit. However, we believe comparable assets trade at 3-5x cash sales."
    • Much more on comScore's accounting problems
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALGN

    FDA clears Dentsply Sirona's clear aligner system; Align Tech eases 2%

    • Align Technology (ALGN -2%) slumps on average volume on the heels of FDA's clearance of Dentsply Sirona's (XRAY +0.1%) clear aligner system today which follows clearance of 3M's version on January 27.
    • Baird says that Align should be able to deliver mid-teens revenue growth despite the competition.
    • Source: The Fly
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • ABT

    Abiomed up 5% on Abbott's travails with HeartMate

    • Abbott's (ABT -0.8%) suspension of enrollment in its HeartMate Shield 2 study and halted commercial sales in Europe stokes buying in Abiomed (ABMD +4.7%), maker of Impella heart pumps. Abbott's difficulties create a rosier outlook for Abiomed, say analysts.
    • Leerink's Danielle Antaffy rates ABMD Outperform with a $140 (27% upside) price target citing a one-to-two-year extension of ABMD's monopoly as result of Abbott's problems. Impella's ramp in Japan, set to start mid-year, should boost sales.
    • Jefferies' Raj Denhoy rates ABMD Buy with a $135 (23% upside) price target. He says Abbott's delay removes a key overhang on ABMD's growth story.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNC

    Big bets on GNC Holdings as earnings approach

    • Options traders are making some big bets on GNC Holdings (GNC -7.6%) ahead of the company's Q4 earnings report due out later this month.
    • Bloomberg reports a block trade of 9.3K Feb $10 puts swapped hands at $1.65 along with 638K shares at $8.95.
    • Shares of GNC are just off their 52-week low.
    • SA contributor Courage & Conviction posted an informative pro and con piece on GNC last week based off a conversation with a hedge fund manager.
    • Volume on GNC today is 50% more than normal activity.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 10 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: SEV +15%. OESX +13%. ASUR +13%. QUIK +12%. AMD +11%.
    • Losers: NIHD -10%. XPLR -10%. MVIS -8%. WPCS -7%. CPSH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • OPTT

    Ocean Power Tech +13% on development and marketing agreement

    • Ocean Power Technologies (OPTT +13.7%) is higher after announcing a joint application development and marketing agreement with HAI Technologies and an initial focus on offshore oil and gas sub-sea chemical injection systems; financial terms of the pact are not disclosed.
    • Houston-based HAI Technologies specializes in products both for high power long wave acoustics and products for oil and gas subsea field development.
    • The companies say combining HAI's subsea chemical injection components with OPTT's PB3 Power Buoy local surface power system will reduce field development cost and potentially make impractical fields practical.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • PME

    Pingtan Marine Enterprises +13% as positive sentiment extends

    • Shares of Pingtan Marine Enterprises (NASDAQ:PME) are up 13.4% on solid volume.
    • The ocean fishing stock is now up 76% YTD.
    • Earlier this month, Pingtan guided for Q1 EPS of $0.08 to $0.10 and noted that market trends are working in its favor.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 1 Comment

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:30 PM

    • Gainers: LOAN +11%. OTC:FNBC +9%. NRT +8%. LFC +7%. GROW +6%.
    • Losers: ZAIS -15%. LGIH -12%. CFBK -7%. YRD -7%. ENVA -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: BCEI +13%. SNMX +13%. COG +11%. PVG +9%. TANH +7%.
    • Losers: ATW -12%. HOS -10%. ORIG -10%. CELP -9%. ESES -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CYAD

    Celyad to explore strategic alternatives for C-Cure; shares ease 2%

    • Belgium-based Celyad (CYAD -2.1%) announces that it intends to evaluate strategic alternatives related to its C-Cure cardiovascular assets. Piper Jaffray is advising.
    • C-Cure is an autologous cell therapy in development for the treatment of ischemic heart failure.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies downgraded to Underweight at Morgan Stanley [updated]

    • Having downgraded Himax Technologies from Overweight to Equal Weight in November 2016 (from which point shares have declined 30%+), Morgan Stanley updates its rating into negative territory.
    • Analyst Charlie Chan: "We now see further threats to the dominance in micro display technology of LCoS (Liquid Crystal on Silicon). Vuzix, one of the leading vendors of AR smart glasses, won the CES Innovation Awards for its Blade 3000 and M3000, which incorporates DLP technology from Texas Instruments. DLP generally has the disadvantage of bigger form factor vs. LCoS, yet our read from Vuzix’s press release suggests that this has been overcome. In addition, MicroVision, the solutions provider for laser MEMS micro display technology, became one of Vuzix's key suppliers starting from 2015."
    • Reduces Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) target from $6 to $4 (current price $5.11, -2.48%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 124 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GALE +35%. PULM +32%. OTCPK:PSIX +28%. SEV +24%. NAKD +17%. ARGS +16%. PME +15%. HAS +15%. OPTT +14%.
    • Losers: SCOR -26%. PETX -19%. LGIH -14%. ATW -12%. ZAIS -12%. CELP -11%. MBRX -11%. XPLR -11%. AOI -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • X

    U.S. Steel now a Buy at Argus following November downgrade

    • U.S. Steel (X +3.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $39 price target at Argus - just three months after the firm issued a downgrade - now saying earnings estimates are rising following the company's bullish 2017 guidance.
    • Argus expects U.S. Steel to return to profitability this year with help from stronger pricing, continued cost reductions and tariffs on imported steel, and sees the company benefiting in 2017-18 from increased infrastructure spending under the Trump administration.
    • The firm also says the stock is trading at a discount to peers based on P/E, price/sales and price/cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: NAKD +16%. PME +14%. HAS +14%.
    • Losers: AOI -8%. HNI -7%. KS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • ADES

    Advanced Emissions Solutions up 6% on buy rating

    • Advanced Emissions Solutions (ADES +5.7%) has received a buy rating from
      analysts at Rodman & Renshaw on coverage initiation.
    • They have set a price target of $18 implying 77% upside on Friday's close of $10.12.
    • The stock is up on thin trading volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • PSIX

    Power Solutions downgraded at Wunderlich amid too much uncertainty

    • Power Solutions International (OTCPK:PSIX +30.9%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Wunderlich, citing uncertainty around PSIX's business prospects following Friday's disclosure that its independent accountant notified the company in its resignation letter of material weaknesses in internal controls, plus the resignation of the CFO.
    • Wunderlich's Liam Burke says despite the long-term potential of PSIX's alternative fuel products and contracts that could drive future revenue, he cannot remain bullish on the stock after the company's disclosures.
    • Shares are bouncing today but are still down more than 50% since the Friday afternoon disclosure.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • ALT

    PharmAthene ex-d today related to $2.91 special dividend; shares up 43%

    • PharmAthene (PIP) heads north 43% on more than a 12x surge in volume. Today is the ex-dividend date for its special $2.91 cash dividend related to the SIGA settlement. The dividend was paid on Friday, February 3.
    • Previously: PharmAthene declares special cash dividend of $2.91 (Nov. 17, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 67 Comments
  • VSTO

    Vista Outdoor slumps to 52-week low

    • DA Davidson lowers Vista Outdoor (VSTO -2.1%) to a Neutral rating from Buy and reduces its price target to $28 from $35.
    • The firm says softening ammunitrition trends "cloud" the earnings outlook.
    • Shares of Vista hit a 52-week low of $24.46 earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas +11% as Atlantic Sunrise pipeline approval sparks upgrades

    • Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +10.9%) surges more than 10% after two firms, J.P. Morgan and Susquehanna, upgrade shares to their equivalent of Buy ratings in reaction to Friday's FERC approval of Williams Cos.' Atlantic Sunrise pipeline project; COG has said it expects to sell ~1B cf/day of gas via the pipeline.
    • In lifting shares to Overweight from Neutral with a $27 price target in the wake of FERC's approval, J.P. Morgan says COG should deliver "years of top-tier growth and free cash flow generation," estimating that the company's gross production will now rise to 3.7B cf/day by year-end 2018 from 2B cf/day at the end of 2016, with the company generating $500M of free cash flow over the next two years.
    • Susquehanna, which now rates shares as Positive with a $26 target, estimates COG could generate $650M of free cash flow over the next two years while delivering nearly 50% production growth between Q4 2016 and Q4 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 4 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: GALE +48%. PULM +31%. ARGS +12%. ANAB +10%. NYMX +9%.
    • Losers: PIP -83%. PETX -15%. MBRX -10%. ROKA -7%. ORPN -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • NWBO

    FDA lifts partial hold on Northwest Bio's late-stage study of DCVax in brain cancer; shares up 5%

    • Northwest Biotherapeutics (OTCQB:NWBO +4.5%) perks up on light volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has lifted the partial clinical hold on its Phase 3 clinical trial assessing DCVax-L for the treatment of glioblastoma multiforme (GBM).
    • The company says the study has accumulated a sufficient number of events (248) for the progression-free survival (PFS) endpoint, but not yet for overall survival (233) (several more months anticipated). Data lock will happen after the OS event threshold is achieved.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 79 Comments
  • SCOR

    Set to miss new compliance deadline, comScore tumbles 21.9%

    • ComScore (NASDAQ:SCOR) has taken a dive, -21.9%, after an update that it won't be able to meet a deadline set by Nasdaq's Hearings Panel over regaining compliance with its reporting requirements.
    • The company, rocked by accounting probes and delayed financials over the past year, was facing Feb. 23 as its latest deadline, but has informed the Panel that it can't make it.
    • "While comScore has made significant progress toward completing the restatement process, it has determined that the aforementioned deadline will not be met," the company says.
    • It's targeting summer 2017 to finish restatement and get current. In the meantime, Nasdaq may suspend the stock from trading and delist it. If that happens, comScore intends to get shares quoted on OTC markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 3 Comments
  • FAST

    Fastenal reports figures for January

    • Net sales up 9% to $336M; Daily sales growth of 3.8%; Daily sales growth of 2.6% in stores more than 10 years old, 3.2% in stores more than 5 years old and 2.9% in stores more than 2 years old.
    • Fastenal's (FAST +4%) total store count totaled 2,505 with two stores opened YTD.
    • Source: TheFly
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • VSTO

    Vista Outdoor on the move

    • Vista Outdoor (NYSE:VSTO) sinks 5.2% in early trade following some analyst coverage.
    • DA Davidson downgraded the stock to Neutral from Buy, citing weakening ammunition trends, and lowered its price target to $28 from $35.
    • Separately, KeyBanc cut its PT on shares to $31 from $39, saying channel checks show that retail demand for firearms and ammo came under increased pressure last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • TSN

    More on Tyson Foods' FQ1

    • Tyson Foods (TSN -2.5%) reports total sales volume rose 1.6% in FQ1.
    • Segment Sales: Chicken: $2.71B (+2.7%); Beef: $3.53B (-2.4%); Pork: $1.25B (+3.2%); Prepared Foods: $1.9B (-0.1%); Other: $90M (-9.1%).
    • Segment Volume change: Chicken: +1.3%; Beef: +4.5%; Pork: +4.3%; Prepared Foods: +2.9%; Other: -6.7%.
    • Segment Average Price change: Chicken: +1.4%; Beef: -6.6%; Pork: -1%; Prepared Foods: -2.9%; Other: -2.7%.
    • Gross margin rate expanded 310 bps to 16.2%.
    • SG&A expense rate grew 110 bps to 5.5%.
    • Operating margin rate increased 220 bps to 10.7%.
    • The company expects overall domestic protein production to increase ~2% to 3% Y/Y in FY2017.
    • FY2017 Guidance: Sales: flat Y/Y; Chicken operating margin: upper end of normalized range of 9% to 11%; Beef operating margin: ~5%; Pork operating margin: ~ 12%; Prepared Foods operating margin: down Y/Y; Other operating loss: ~$70M; Adjusted EPS: $4.90 - $5.05; Capital expenditure: ~1B; Net interest expense: ~$230M; Liquidity: in range of $1B.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • HAS

    Hasbro runs to all-time high after earnings

    • Hasbro (HAS N/A) pops to an all-time high after Q4 earnings dazzle on broad-based strength.
    • The company topped most estimates in the boys and girls categories for the quarter.
    • Management also points to the gaming business after it generated 11% revenue growth to $519M, calling it a "competitive differentiator" in the toy industry.
    • Shares of Mattel (MAT N/A) are also on the move after the solid numbers from its peer.
    • Previously: Hasbro beats by $0.37, beats on revenue (Feb. 6)
    • Previously: Hasbro positive post Q4 results (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 13 Comments
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile +2.1% as Roth upgrades on bookings positivity

    • Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) has opened up 2.1% after an upgrade from Roth Capital, to Buy, ahead of the company's Wednesday earnings report.
    • The firm thinks its bookings may come in above guidance (for $46M-$48M), and that Q1 bookings are tracking ahead of estimates as well.
    • In addition, the core portfolio (anchored by Kim Kardashian: Hollywood) has stabilized, which suggests some growth possibilities from newer, non-celebrity-focused games, says Darren Aftahi.
    • He's lifted his price target to $3.25 from $2.00, implying 31% upside from here.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 15 Comments
  • AAL

    American Airlines Group shakes off negative Bernstein call

    • Bernstein upgrades American Airlines Group (NASDAQ:AAL) to Market Perform from Underperform and gives its price target on the carrier a bump to $43.
    • The firm pulls its negative stance on AAL after factoring in macro trends and American's recently-issued guidance for 2017.
    • Shares of America are up 1.20% to $44.73 premarket vs. a 52-week trading range of $24.85 to $50.64.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 8 Comments
  • SLS

    Galena's two mid-stage NeuVax studies to continue as planned; shares ahead 82% premarket

    • Nano cap Galena Biopharma (GALE) is up 82% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement that its two Phase 2 studies assessing NeuVax, in combination with Roche's Herceptin (trastuzumab), to prevent the recurrence of breast cancer will continue as planned.
    • The independent Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB) reviewed the data and determined that there were no safety signals and neither study was found to be futile.
    • In the Phase 2b trial in breast cancer patients with low-to-intermediate HER2 expression, the DSMB backed a change in the timing for the interim efficacy analysis, moving it up to six months after the last patient is enrolled instead of 12 months. The DSMD expects to perform the analysis by year end.
    • The other Phase 2, in high-risk HER2 3+ patients, will continue unmodified.
    • NeuVax is an HER2-directed immunotherapy being investigated for the prevention of breast cancer recurrence after standard-of-care treatment in the adjuvant setting. Adjuvant therapy is any treatment given after primary (first-line) therapy.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 14 Comments
  • RBS

    RBS expected to unveil new cost cuts

    • Royal Bank of Scotland (NYSE:RBS) is preparing to unveil new cost-cutting measures when the bank reports its expected ninth consecutive annual loss later this month, The Guardian reports.
    • CEO Ross McEwan has already admitted he will miss his target to slash the bank's cost-income ratio by 2019 because of Brexit.
    • RBS -2.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • APO

    Apollo Global Management gains after BAML upgrade

    • Shares of Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) break higher in early trading after Bank of America Merrill Lynch ungrades to Buy from Neutral.
    • BAML lifts its price target to $27 from $23 on its view that Apollo's fee-related earnings will improve and investors may see more distributions.
    • APO +1.90% premarket to $22.55.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: GALE +91%. NAKD +29%. HAS +12%. CERU +12%. OTCPK:PSIX +9%. PULM +9%. COG +8%. PERI +5%.
    • Losers: PIP -84%. PETX -9%. DRD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 4 Comments
  • TIF

    Investors scramble after CEO exit at Tiffany

    • Shares of Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) are down sharply after the company announces the exit of CEO Frederic Cumenal.
    • Mizuho downgrades the retailer to Neutral from Buy and takes its price target down to $74 from $90.
    • Analyst Bety Chen thinks consensus estimates on Tiffany are too high amid the near-term headwinds in Asia-Pacific and Europe.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • TIF -3.06% premarket to $78.01 vs. a 52-week trading range of $56.99 to $85.44. Looking ahead, Tiffany is due to report earnings on March 17.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM

  • PETX

    Aratana says ENTYCE will not be commercially available until Q4; shares down 18% premarket

    • in a regulatory filing, Aratana Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PETX) reports that ENTYCE (capromorelin oral solution), approved by the FDA's Center for Veterinary Medicine (CVM) in May 2016, will not be commercially available until late 2017 while it works through the regulatory requirements to transfer manufacturing to a new vendor. The company received a response from CVM on February 2 requesting additional information regarding the proposed transfer.
    • ENTYCE is a flavored oral liquid approved to treat dogs who have lost their desire to eat, a condition affecting 10M canines each year.
    • Shares are off 18% premarket on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 42 Comments
  • DAL

    Bernstein sees clear skies for Delta

    • Bernstein upgrades Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) to Outperform from Market Perform on its view revenue management strategies will pay off.
    • 'While the conventional view seems to be that it can't get any better at DAL, we think the company has been a pioneer in revenue management and as this is all undiscovered country don’t feel comfortable putting a cap on margin potential in the short term," writes analyst David Vernon.
    • The investment firm is also more comfortable on the macro environment for the airline sector and booking trends.
    • Shares of Delta are up 1.44% premarket to $48.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • NWL

    Newell Rubbermaid lower post Q4 results

    • Newell Rubbermaid (NYSE:NWL) reports core sales growth of 2.5% in Q4, driven by strong results from the Writing, Baby, Home Solutions and Outdoor Solutions businesses.
    • Segment revenue growth: Writing: $462.4M (-0.8%, Core sales: +4.3%); Home Solutions: $391M (-11.5%, Core sales: +5.7%); Tools: $198.1M (-4.6%, Core sales: -21.1%); Commercial Products: $208.9M (+1%, Core sales: +0.8%); Baby & Parenting: $241.7M (+1.6%, Core sales: +3.6%); Branded Consumables: $1.1B; Consumer Solutions: $709.7M; Outdoor Solutions: $730.6M; Process Solutions: $88.9M.
    • Normalized gross margin fell 120 bps to 37.2%.
    • Normalized operating margin rate grew 260 bps to 16.3%.
    • FY2017 Guidance: Net sales: $14.52B to $14.72B (+9.5% to +11%); Core sales: +2.5% to +4%; Normalized EPS: $2.95 to $3.15; Tax rate: 26% to 27%.
    • NWL -2.99% premarket.

    Chipotle on watch after negative Barron's piece

    • Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) tilt lower in early trading after a weekend piece in Barron's points to the risk of higher expenses at the chain.
    • "We see no reason to doubt that food safety at Chipotle is improving and that fans can eat there with confidence. We have reservations, however, about the safety of earnings forecasts and the share price," writes Jack Hough.
    • A worst-case scenario of a 35% drop in share price is laid out.
    • CMG -1.22% premarket to $399.15.

  • HAS

    Hasbro positive post Q4 results

    • Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) reports revenue rose 12% in Q4 after excluding the foreign exchange impact.
    • U.S. and Canada revenue increased 10% to 757.52M.
    • International revenue +10% to $757.74M, led by 21% growth in Latin America.
    • Entertainment and Licensing revenue soar 36% to $114.68M.
    • Sales by product category: Boys: $552.3M (-5%); Games: $518.7M (+11%); Girls: $394.2M (+52%), Preschool: $164.8M (-4%).
    • Franchise brand revenue grew 2% to $685.61M and Partner brand revenue up 16% to $433.72M.
    • Hasbro gaming revenue up 23% to $356.92M and Emerging brands expanded 18% to $153.69M for the quarter.
    • Operating margin rate declined 200 bps to 15.7%.
    • HAS +6.68% premarket.
